thread.title: Head of CAR's election commission resigns
thread.title_full: Head of CAR's election commission resigns | News24

author: news24.com
title: Head of CAR's election commission resigns
text:
Bangui - The president of Central African Republic's election commission said on Friday he had resigned, casting further doubt on plans for a vote meant to restore democracy to a country rocked by fighting since 2013.
Dieudonne Kombo Yaya gave no reasons for his decision but told state radio he doubted the vote, scheduled for October 18, could be held this year. The authority's vice president also stepped down last month.
The elections are supposed to bring in a new government with the authority to restore order in one of Africa's most turbulent states and pave the way for the departure of UN and French peacekeepers.
Central African Republic plunged into turmoil in 2013 when Muslim rebels from an umbrella group called Seleka seized power in the majority-Christian country.
